â€“ Men det skal ikke vÃ¦re noe problem Ã¥ bli enda bedre. Allerede denne sesongen har jeg gÃ¥tt pÃ¥ 39,59, under ganske dÃ¥rlige forhold. Jeg har mye jeg skal jobbe med, sier den offensive Fana-lÃ¸peren.
Hun har som mÃ¥l Ã¥ bli verdens beste kvinnelige sprinter. PÃ¥ Ã¸nskelisten stÃ¥r bÃ¥de OL- og VM-tittel. Hun vet det er mulig. NÃ¥r treningskameraten heter HÃ¥vard Holmefjord Lorentzen, har hun en ganske god idÃ© om hva som kreves.
â€“ Jeg vet vi er mange som deler den samme drÃ¸mmen, men jeg har ikke tenkt Ã¥ gi slipp pÃ¥ den. Jeg har tatt ganske store steg, sier Samsonsen.


STORE STEG: Julie Nistad Samsonsen debuterte i verdenscupen siste sesong. Her fra konkurransene pÃ¥ Hamar.ğŸ“· Vegard Wivestad GrÃ¸tt / BILDBYRÃ…N NORWAY

Det bekrefter Edel Therese HÃ¸iseth, som er assistenttrener for bÃ¥de sprint og allround.
â€“ Ja, hun har tatt store steg, men har fortsatt mye Ã¥ jobbe med. Hun er en dame for fremtiden, sier HÃ¸iseth, som beskriver Samsonsen som Â«spenstig og hurtigÂ», med gode fysiske forutsetninger for skÃ¸ytesprint.

SÃ¸ndag drar hun til Hamar for Ã¥ trene i en uke. Deretter gÃ¥r det slag i slag med konkurranser, forutsatt at hun blir valgt av SkÃ¸yteforbundet til Ã¥ representere Norge ogsÃ¥ i fortsettelsen. Det ferskeste uttaket gjelder for de to fÃ¸rste konkurransen i verdenscupen, i Minsk (Hviterussland) og Tomaszow Maziewecki (Polen). Resultatene der avgjÃ¸r om hun ogsÃ¥ blir uttatt til lÃ¸pene i Nur-Sultan (tidligere Astana i Kasakhstan) og Nagano (Japan). For dem som blir uttatt, blir det knapt tid til en svipptur hjemom mellom slagene.
Julie Nistad Samsonsen er helt fersk pÃ¥ landslaget. Som andre ferskinger tilhÃ¸rer hun C-gruppen blant landslagslÃ¸perne. I praksis betyr det at hun mÃ¥ finansiere sin deltakelse av egne midler. Noe av det stiller Fana IL opp med. Men om lag halvparten av utgiftene mÃ¥ hun dekke selv, ved hjelp av familie og sponsorer.
Men selv om det koster henne en god del penger, er hun kjempeglad for Ã¥ vÃ¦re en del av landslaget, med Jeremy Wotherspoon som trener.

â€“ Det er kjekt og inspirerende Ã¥ ligge bak guttene og kjenne at teknikken fungerer. Kanskje lÃ¦re nye ting og ta nye steg. Det gir en veldig god mestringsfÃ¸lelse, sier Julie Nistad Samsonsen, som ikke er avhengig av selskap for Ã¥ trives med trening.
â€“ Nei, jeg opplever en stor treningsglede og har god selvdisiplin. Det er gÃ¸yere Ã¥ trene sammen med noen, men det gÃ¥r helt fint alene ogsÃ¥.

Ny isarena i Bergen kan koste opp mot Ã©n milliard kroner. NÃ¥ hÃ¥per man tidene med mÃ¥king av vann snart er over.
text:
Fana runner ready for the World Cup. Now she wants to copy the Olympic hero Lorentzen.
Quite quietly, Fana runner Julie Nistad Samsonsen (19) has taken the step into the Norwegian elite on ice skating. Now she is in the World Cup.
06 Nov 2019, 10:02 by Knut Langeland
In mid-November, she gets the chance again in the World Cup, in the competitions in Belarus Minsk. It published the Skating Association on Monday.
- I think I deserve it, says the teenager.
Only 13 Norwegian women have walked the 500 meters in under 40 seconds. Precisely Julie Nistad Samsonsen turned 13 when she noted the time 39.84 in the Norgescup event in Stavanger on January 6 this year. Later that season, she lowered her own personal record to 39.54.

Sverre Lunde Pedersen with weak times: That's why he's not worried

Great potential
- But there should be no problem getting even better. Already this season I have gone at 39.59, under pretty bad conditions. I have a lot to work on, â€says the offensive Fana runner.
She aims to become the world's best female sprinter. On the wish list is both the Olympic and World Cup titles. She knows it's possible. When the training buddy is named HÃ¥vard Holmefjord Lorentzen, she has a pretty good idea of what is required.
- I know we are many who share the same dream, but I do not intend to let go of it. I've taken quite a big step, says Samsonsen.


BIG STEPS: Julie Nistad Samsonsen debuted in the World Cup last season. Here from the competitions at Hamar.ğŸ“· Vegard Wivestad GrÃ¸tt / BILDBYRÃ…N NORWAY

This is confirmed by Edel Therese HÃ¸iseth, who is an assistant coach for both sprint and all-round.
- Yes, she has taken big steps, but still has a lot to work on. She is a lady for the future, says HÃ¸iseth, who describes Samsonsen as "resilient and fast", with good physical conditions for skating.
Samsonsen is per. today the second best sprinter in Norway, behind Ida NjÃ¥tun, but ahead of Hege BÃ¸kko. This spring she finished high school. Now she has given herself a year off, "to lift her head", but above all to skate.
- It will be exciting to see if it gives positive results, or if I also need something else to think about.
The start of the season has been uplifting. Samsonsen believes she is further ahead in development this season than she did at the same time last year.

Lunde Pedersen believes the "magic" limit can be broken this season

A lot of traveling
- I was far behind my personal record then than I am now, analyzes the 19-year-old, who can quickly attend a busy Christmas season.
On Sunday she goes to Hamar to train for a week. Thereafter, competitions go on, provided she is chosen by the Skating Association to represent Norway in the future as well. The freshest draw applies to the first two competitions in the World Cup, in Minsk (Belarus) and Tomaszow Maziewecki (Poland). The results there determine whether she will also be selected for the races in Nur-Sultan (formerly Astana in Kazakhstan) and Nagano (Japan). For those who are exhausted, there is hardly time for a swipe home between the battles.
Julie Nistad Samsonsen is fresh on the national team. Like other freshmen, she belongs to the C group among the national team runners. In practice, this means that she has to finance her participation with her own funds. Some of it Fana IL puts up with. But about half of the expenses she has to cover herself, with the help of family and sponsors.
But even though it costs her a good deal of money, she is thrilled to be part of the national team, with Jeremy Wotherspoon as coach.

Lorentzen has taken two steps to recreate the dream season



EXAMPLE: She has found inspiration in Fana's teammates. Now Julie Nistad Samsonsen hopes to be an inspiration for the younger athletes in the club.ğŸ“· Vegard Wivestad GrÃ¸tt / BILDBYRÃ…N NORWAY

Versatile
- It's been a big goal for me ever since I was a kid.
Samsonsen says that during her childhood she has tried different sports, in several clubs. She has visited football, handball, gymnastics, tennis and climbing. The versatility has given her a lot.
- But now I know a very belonging to Fana IL, says the sprinter from NordÃ¥s. In the mother club she enjoys working out with the very best.
- It is nice and inspiring to be behind the boys and to know that the technique works. Maybe learn new things and take new steps. It gives a very good sense of mastery, says Julie Nistad Samsonsen, who does not depend on companies to enjoy training.
- No, I experience a great training pleasure and have good self-discipline. It is more fun to work out with someone, but it is fine alone.

New ice arena in Bergen can cost up to NOK 1 billion. It is now hoped that the times of water-gouging will soon be over.
